title: I_Anime
author: I_Anime
content: Bitcointalk has been active for over a decade and is still getting better everyday ,Though it has some hard times like the time it was hacked and others but still yet it continues to improve. Bitcointalk has been able to stay this long and improving because of contributions from members of the Forum starting with the founder Satoshi Nakamoto and other awesome members. It is a fact that Most Newbies now join Bitcointalk just to make money and this is not the main aim of this forum but thankfully you can't really earn without contributing or by breaking the rules and regulations because there are still  True members  watching this Forum So my advice for we Newbies is start thinking of a way of improving this forum first before earning.

comments.author: Iroh
comments.body: I wouldn’t say it’s a fact that most newbies now join Bitcointalk forum for the sole purpose of making money. While a lot actually do come on here to make some money, I’d also like to think that the majority of people that find their way to the Bitcointalk forum come here looking for information and to interact with other people about bitcoin. They come looking for information, receive loads and loads of it and would obviously decide to stay. I think the forum is really accommodating as it began originally to talk about bitcoin but grew to accommodate other discussions and boards as well. It accommodates everyone also. The people on here are also matured and there is mutual respect between members. Everyone is free to be themselves. About earning, you’ve just got to first contribute and be a meaningful participant in the forum. Only then would you be eligible to earn some money. You get to learn new stuff and contribute what you know and earn while doing it. A win win

comments.author: Ojima-ojo
comments.body: What part of the hack did i missed?I never know this forum have been hacked before and I am only reading about that now from this thread come to think of it, I have thought the forum to be open source that way it allows users to contribute to its development both technical and otherwise.And Another point to note is that as a newbie, you should pay more attention to learning and building your knowledge first before diving into making any contribution or suggestion, that way you can make a meaningful contribution that will be helpful to other members of the forum.I don don't why most people here refer to bitcointalk as olace to make money and I don't know how that works aside from the incentives given for participating in signature renting aside from that, what other ways are there for members to make legitimate money that required forum involvement.

comments.author: PrivacyG
comments.body: Quote from: I_Anime on January 04, 2023, 06:40:30 PMIt is a fact that Most Newbies now join Bitcointalk just to make money and this is not the main aim of this forum but thankfully you can't really earn without contributing or by breaking the rules and regulations because there are still  True members  watching this Forum So my advice for we Newbies is start thinking of a way of improving this forum first before earning. I initially did not want to join a Signature Campaign ever.  But it comes to a point where you ask yourself.  What am I winning by missing out on this chance.  If others consider my posts be worth something and I can earn something from it, by denying an offer I am only missing out on it and some body else will take the position.All good posters probably thought about this at one point.  But I rather see good posters occupying Campaign positions instead of members posting useless replies and threads.  The Bounty Campaigns were producing enough spam already.You can be a good poster and still be in a Signature Campaign.  I do not think these two are tied in any way.  You just continue doing what ever you did before.  The difference is you now earn something off it too.But I believe this only applies to Campaigns with flexible rules.  If you have a fixed minimum number of posts per week to be paid.  Or have to post a minimum amount of replies in a particular board.  Or the number of boards your posts are counted in is very limited.  Things change.  Members of the Campaign will start posting irrelevant replies to fulfill their weekly paycheck requirements.My advice is.  Only stay on this forum if you have legitimate interest in Bitcoin and Cryptocurrencies.  If you are here for weekly payments.  You will have a hard time earning.-Regards,PrivacyG

comments.author: DdmrDdmr
comments.body: I stumbled across this forum through a google search when the 2017 xMas hype was big on bitcoin. Finding forums good repositories of Q&As in other contexts, I probably searched for "bitcoin forum" or "best bitcoin forum" at the time, and was promptly redirected to Bitcointalk.Being novel to all this, I had loads of questions in my mind, though I normally, as a habit, try to obtain the answers by reading thoroughly through, rather than formulating the questions straight off, gathering more context in the event. I guess I found plenty of pointers here, as looking over my initial posts, they weren’t very question centered (I did get distracted by altcoins for a while it seems).I have looked over other forums briefly, and occasionally visit one or two in other languages, normally to contrast something local with other opinions in order to get a broader view, but the sheer volume of information on Bitcointalk is a retainer. One does though need to learn to separate the wheat from the chaff, and develop a kind of sense of what is more meaningful, credible, from whom, and persist in the habit of contrasting information.

People are given the right answers to their questions in excess, they're now left to choose the best out of the many. I've not read of an old article or project about bitcoin and didn't come across bitcointalk. The forum has been here serving many people who have interest in cryptocurrency, even the big influencers on twitter like hodlonaut once referred in his tweet the fun of the bitcointalk forum. So, we'll are lucky to have such a solid forum for bitcoin knowledge from ground level up till development and technical level. Its members who are the bedrock of the forum offers the best knowledge and also work hard to keep the forum neat and conducive.
